Material used.Description: Cell viability assays revealed that treatment of untransfected or vector-transfected PC12 cells with H2O2 resulted in cell death.

Readout description.Molecular Effect: Dominant negative effect on cell survival
Readout description.Result Description: The pathogenic G309D mutation not only abolished the cytoprotective effect of PINK1, but also exacerbated oxidative-stress-induced cell death.

Readout description.Molecular Effect: Dominant negative effect on cell survival
Readout description.Result Description: The pathogenic L347P mutation not only abolished the cytoprotective effect of PINK1, but also accelerated H2O2-induced cytochrome c release.
The W437X mutation caused a 30% to 45% reduction in both basal and oxidative-stress-induced levels of TRAP1 phosphorylation in vivo compared with wild-type PINK1.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: ANOVA with Tukey’s post hoc analysis

Material used.Description: PC12 cells were transfected with C-terminally FLAG-tagged wild-type or mutant PINK1 to achieve similar levels of exogenous PINK1 protein expression.

Readout description.Molecular Effect: Dominant negative effect on cell survival
Readout description.Result Description: Cells overexpressing G309D or L347P mutant PINK1 had approximately 50% lower levels of both basal and oxidative-stress-induced TRAP1 phosphorylation than the untransfected cells.

Readout description.Molecular Effect: Dominant negative effect on cell survival
Readout description.Result Description: Cells overexpressing G309D or L347P mutant PINK1 had approximately 50% lower levels of both basal and oxidative-stress-induced TRAP1 phosphorylation than the untransfected cells.
Overexpression of W437X mutant PINK1 resulted in a 30% to 45% reduction in both basal and oxidative-stress-induced levels of TRAP1 phosphorylation in vivo compared with wild-type PINK1.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: ANOVA with Tukey’s post hoc analysis

Material used.Description: The release of cytochrome c from mitochondria to the cytosol was determined by immunoblotting with anti-cytochrome c antibody.

Readout description.Molecular Effect: Dominant negative effect on cell survival
Readout description.Result Description: The pathogenic G309D mutation not only abolished the ability of PINK1 to suppress cytochrome c release, but also accelerated H2O2-induced cytochrome c release.

Readout description.Molecular Effect: Dominant negative effect on cell survival
Readout description.Result Description: The pathogenic L347P mutation not only abolished the ability of PINK1 to suppress cytochrome c release, but also accelerated H2O2-induced cytochrome c release.
The W437X mutation caused a significant increase in H2O2-induced cytochrome c release compared to cells expressing similar levels of exogenous wild-type PINK1.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: ANOVA with Tukey’s post hoc analysis
